intro: Helianthemum guttatum var. pomelii, commonly known as the rock rose, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, fleshy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer. The plant has succulent leaves that are covered in a waxy coating, helping it retain moisture in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its hardy nature and ornamental value make it a popular choice for drought-tolerant gardens.
